revised_title: Cultural Evolution of Cyclamen latifolium and the Debate on Plant Variation
tldr: Thiselton Dyer presents a case study of the cultural evolution of Cyclamen latifolium, discussing the debate on plant variation and the role of continuous selection under cultivation. He addresses criticisms of his choice of example, the garden cineraria, and the process of its improvement, referencing Charles Darwin's work on the subject.
